frameDefinitions: A salient Subevent has a Pattern of recurrence within a larger Process.
A Hunter tries to gain Food by way of outsmarting or tracking a living.
The Payer is (legally) forced to pay a Fine by an official Speaker as a punishment for some action (the Reason).
An Entity is in motion  at a particular Speed, a momentaneous description of distance traveled per time.
The Noise_maker is an artifact used to produce sound, especially for musical effect.
An Agent manipulates a Sound_maker or a Cause causes the Sound_maker to emit a sound.
frameExamples: Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard
In the Congo, he hunted big game for the first time.
They were <t>fined</t> approximately $3.1 billion dollars for their knowing, malicious injury to consumers.
The monks would <t>ring</t> the bell until sundown.
listRoleDefinitions: The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of  the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> .
The <fen>Hunter</fen> is the agent hoping to obtain <fen>Food</fen>.
<fen>Food</fen> is the sought-out item by the <fen>Hunter</fen>.
This is the entity to which the <fen>Hunter</fen> pays attention. It is referred to as <fen>Ground</fen> because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Food</fen>.
When the <fen>Time</fen> seeking action occurs.
The greater geographic location where the <fen>Hunter</fen> attempts to obtain <fen>Food</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who imposes the <fen>Fine</fen> upon the <fen>Payer</fen>.
The <fen>Payer</fen> is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made.  With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:

Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g. I <t>admire</t> you <fex name='Reason'>for your intellect</fex>. For some words in this domain, the Reason frame element is obligatory. That is to say, the overt expression of this frame element may only be omitted when the reason for the judgment is understood from context. For example, the sentence 'I <t>blame</t> you!' can only be uttered when it is clear what the addressee is being blamed for.
The money given to expiate some debt for transgression.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose <fen>Speed</fen> is under consideration.

The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is a function of the distance that the <fen>Entity</fen> moves in a given duration. With the adjectives of this frame this Frame Element is generally incorporated.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s speed.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Speed</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Speed</fen>.
This role identifies the entity or substance that is designed to produce sound.
The individual that manipulates a Sound_maker so that it makes Noise.
The entity that produces the Noise, as a result of the action of the Agent.
The inanimate force of nature that causes the <fen>Sound_maker</fen> to produce noise.
The time at which the noise is produced.
The location at which the sound is produced.
listRoleExamples: The rhythm <fex>of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake
The music had a driving rhythm
The mental control officer fined <fex>you</fex> for your lack of diligence.
<fex>You</fex> can ring the bell as often as you'd like.

passageCandidateSpans.text: A New Useful and Complete System of Drum Beating

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the New Jersey Society of Poets
The National Association of Rudimental Drummers
the Percussive Arts Society (P.A.S.) Marching Percussion Committee
A New Useful and Complete System of Drum Beating
The Rudimental Principles of Drum – Beating
Bruce and Emmett's Drummers and Fifers Guide with the words Rudimental Principles
Recapitulation of the Preceeding Rolls and Beats
